content.text: HTML Ordered Lists
The HTML <ol> tag defines an ordered list. An ordered list can be numerical or alphabetical.
content.html: The HTML <ol> tag defines an ordered list. An ordered list can be numerical or alphabetical.

content.text: Ordered HTML List
An ordered list starts with the <ol> tag. Each list item starts with the <li> tag.
content.html: An ordered list starts with the <ol> tag. Each list item starts with the <li> tag.

content.text: The list items will be marked with numbers by default:
content.html: The list items will be marked with numbers by default:

content.code_html:
<ol>
  <li>Coffee</li>
  <li>Tea</li>
  <li>Milk</li>
</ol>

content.text: Ordered HTML List - The Type Attribute
The type attribute of the <ol> tag, defines the type of the list item marker:
content.html: The type attribute of the <ol> tag, defines the type of the list item marker:

content.code_html:
Type Description
type="1" The list items will be numbered with numbers (default)
type="A" The list items will be numbered with uppercase letters
type="a" The list items will be numbered with lowercase letters
type="I" The list items will be numbered with uppercase roman numbers
type="i" The list items will be numbered with lowercase roman numbers

content.text: Numbers

content.code_html:
<ol type="1">
  <li>Coffee</li>
  <li>Tea</li>
  <li>Milk</li>
</ol>

content.text: Uppercase Letters

content.code_html:
<ol type="A">
  <li>Coffee</li>
  <li>Tea</li>
  <li>Milk</li>
</ol>

content.text: Lowercase Letters

content.code_html:
<ol type="a">
  <li>Coffee</li>
  <li>Tea</li>
  <li>Milk</li>
</ol>

content.text: Roman Numbers - Uppercase

content.code_html:
<ol type="I">
  <li>Coffee</li>
  <li>Tea</li>
  <li>Milk</li>
</ol>

content.text: Roman Numbers - Lowercase

content.code_html:
<ol type="i">
  <li>Coffee</li>
  <li>Tea</li>
  <li>Milk</li>
</ol>

content.text: Control List Counting
By default, an ordered list will start counting from 1. If you want to start counting from a specified number, you can use the start attribute:
content.html: By default, an ordered list will start counting from 1. If you want to start counting from a specified number, you can use the start attribute:

content.code_html:
<ol start="50">
  <li>Coffee</li>
  <li>Tea</li>
  <li>Milk</li>
</ol>

content.text: Nested HTML Lists
Lists can be nested (list inside list):

content.code_html:
<ol>
  <li>Coffee</li>
  <li>Tea
    <ol>
      <li>Black tea</li>
      <li>Green tea</li>
    </ol>
  </li>
  <li>Milk</li>
</ol>

content.text: Note: A list item ( <li> ) can contain a new list, and other HTML elements, like images and links, etc.
content.html: Note: A list item (<li>) can contain a new list, and other HTML elements, like images and links, etc.

content.text: Chapter Summary
Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the correct HTML attribute to use when defining the type of the list item marker of ordered lists?
content.html: What is the correct HTML attribute to use when defining the type of the list item marker of ordered lists?

metadata.question: What is the correct HTML attribute to use when defining the type of the list item marker of ordered lists?

content.question: What is the correct HTML attribute to use when defining the type of the list item marker of ordered lists?

content.text: HTML List Tags

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<ul> Defines an unordered list
<ol> Defines an ordered list
<li> Defines a list item
<dl> Defines a description list
<dt> Defines a term in a description list
<dd> Describes the term in a description list

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
